page.title: 10Pevensey, Westham Councils.
page.content: Pevensey and Westham each have Parish Councils.There are 13{councillors,}and a clerk to the council.These councils were started at the end of the C19 and look after{local problems.}Councillors are elected every 4 years.Each council meets monthly,holding full councils meetings to make decisions about the parish and vote on proposals.On alternate months committee meetings are held where groups discuss issues and then advise the full council.The council owns street lights,public seats,various halls,recreation grounds and parts of the beach.The{money}they can spend comes from the{general rates and is about{twelve thousand pounds }a year.Current problems include car parking,a village by pass and boundary changes.
